title: Corda P2P Link Manager Configuration Schema
description: Configuration schema for the P2P link manager.

maxMessageSize.description: The maximum message size in bytes.

replayAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to schedule messages for replay.

exponentialBackoff.description: Replay messages with capped exponential backoff.

baseReplayPeriod.description: The message replay period base in milliseconds.

replayPeriodCutoff.description: The message replay period cutoff in milliseconds.

constant.description: Replay messages at a constant rate.

messageReplayPeriod.description: The message replay period in milliseconds.

maxReplayingMessages.description: The maximum number of replaying messages between two peers.

heartbeatEnabled.description: Deprecated (not used). Whether heartbeat messages should be sent or not between peers to detect unhealthy sessions.

heartbeatMessagePeriod.description: Deprecated (not used). The heartbeat message period in milliseconds.

sessionsPerPeer.description: Deprecated (not used). The number of actively maintained sessions between two peers.

numOfSessionsPerPeer.description: Deprecated (not used). The number of actively maintained sessions between two peers.

forMgm.description: The number of actively maintained sessions between two peers if one of them is an MGM. Communication between an MGM and a member is not considered critical and so the default value of 1 is recommended to improve performance.

forMembers.description: The number of actively maintained sessions between two peers if both peers are members. The default value of 2 is recommended because the chance of both sessions failing on the same link manager is relatively low. If high-availability is critical, R3 recommends deploying multiple link manager instances instead.

revocationCheck.description: The type of revocation check for the session certificate.

oneOf.title: The revocation check will succeed if the revocation status cannot be determined under certain circumstances. See java.security.cert.PKIXRevocationChecker.Option.SOFT_FAIL java doc for more details.
The opposite of SOFT_FAIL. This is the most rigorous check. Amongst other requirements, this check requires that the CRL checking URL is available on every level of certificate chain.

sessionRefreshThreshold.description: Deprecated (not used). The session refresh threshold in seconds. The default value is five days.

inboundSessionsCacheSize.description: The number of inbound sessions to keep in the link manager cache.

outboundSessionsCacheSize.description: The number of outbound sessions to keep in the link manager cache.
